Curriculum Formalization: Implicit or non-existent; typically greedy or exhaustive search
Delta (Our Novelty): Lacks explicit, staged curriculum and LLM-driven hypothesis generation in a rich graph.

Experiment Representation: Runs, experiments, artifacts (flat or loosely grouped)
Curriculum Formalization: None; they are passive tracking tools, not schedulers
Delta (Our Novelty): Does not propose or schedule experiments; purely a system of record.

Curriculum Formalization: Implicit through prompting and goal decomposition
Delta (Our Novelty): State representation is not a formal experiment graph; no concept of a scientific curriculum.

Curriculum Formalization: Implicit through fitness functions and population dynamics
Delta (Our Novelty): Curriculum is emergent, not declarative. Graph representation is not used for planning.

Experiment Representation: Model weights, preference data, reward model state
Curriculum Formalization: Often manual or based on simple heuristics (e.g., task difficulty)
Delta (Our Novelty): Lacks a generalized graph to represent diverse experiments beyond reward modeling.
